result.execSummary:
The defendant Reece A Slater was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with prison sentence being served.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $330 to Paul Zochert, American Offroad Service LLC, 1116 N. Irwin Avenue, Green Bay, WI  54302, plus statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Door County Restitution Summary
Defendant appeared in custody.

Defendant Reece A Slater in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell. Defendant Reece A Slater in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding proposed sentence, current prison sentence being served. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement.
to Transport
Corrected
by State

Defendant Reece A Slater appeared by video conference from Racine Youthful Offender Correctional Facility. Attorney Travis A. Crowell in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on length of sentence (2/4/18).  Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim, mailed waiver form to Defendant with return envelope, has not received form back. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Court questions Defense, who has reviewed offer with Defendant. Court questions what should be set. Defense requests that arraignment be scheduled, may be plea/sentencing. Court questions Defendant on whether he thinks he will accept State's offer. Defendant thinks he will.  Arraignment scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Video Conference for 1/30/15 at 11:15 scheduled with Racine Youthful Offender Correctional Facility

Defendant Reece A Slater appeared by video conference from Dodge Correctional Institution. Attorney Travis A. Crowell in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense requests prelim next week. State suggests that status be set for next week, will get out an offer. Defense advises that if offer is forthcoming, Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, who will do whatever his attorney suggests. Defense advises that Defendant to waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Initial appearance on January 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
by Defendant
Extradite from adjacent states only
